document.heading: Legalization of Marijuana for Medical Treatment Amendment Act of 2010

history.narrative: Law 18-210, the “Legalization of Marijuana for Medical Treatment Amendment Act of 2010”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 18-622, which was referred to the Committee on Health and the Committee on Public Safety and the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 20, 2010, and May 4, 2010, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 21, 2010, it was assigned Act No. 18-429 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 18-210 became effective on July 27, 2010.
For history of Law 19-,104 see notes under § 3-1201.02.
